title: MAFS' Martha Kalifatidis on how much she's paid per Instagram post
text:
Married At First Sight's Martha Kalifatidis has cashed in on her newfound fame.

The reality star, who previously worked as a makeup artist prior to the show, now works as a full-time influencer.

Speaking to The Daily Telegraph on Sunday, the 31-year-old refused to confirm how much she's paid per Instagram post.

'Talking about money and figures is crass': MAFS' Martha Kalifatidis, 31, refused to confirm how much she's paid per Instagram post, in an interview with The Daily Telegraph on Sunday

'I feel like talking about money and figures is a little bit crass,' Martha explained.

'I'd be embarrassed to say, not because it's too low or high, but then people start to do the numbers.'

The brunette, who lives in Melbourne with her parents, said people often assume not much work is involved as an influencer.

'So much goes into it (posting photos),' she revealed. 'I think influencers do get a bit of a bad rap.'

According to website InfluencerFree, which calculates how much an influencer is worth based on the amount of followers they have, Martha earns around $700 for each sponsored post.

Smoke and mirrors: The former makeup artist revealed 'so much' work goes into posting photos online

Hundreds: According to website InfluencerFree, Martha earns around $700 for each sponsored post

Martha has 290,000 followers, putting her at the top of her Instagram game.

She recently returned from Los Angeles with boyfriend Michael Brunelli, 28, whom she 'wed' in a non legally-binding ceremony on this year's Married At First Sight.

They are one of two remaining couples from the season, alongside Cameron Merchant and Jules Robinson.

On September 29, Martha marked their one-year 'wedding' anniversary, taking to Instagram to share a photo of herself naked and embracing Michael.

Going strong: The brunette is still dating primary school teacher Michael Brunelli (right), 28, whom she 'wed' in a non legally-binding ceremony on this year's Married At First Sight

Since skyrocketing to fame on the reality dating series, Martha has emerged as one of Australia's most popular influencers.

She now leads a life of luxury attending celebrity events, and jetting to and from exotic destinations on trips with her primary school teacher beau.

Martha has worked with major brands from fashion powerhouse Pretty Little Thing to apps such as ShopBack.
description: Married At First Sight's Martha Kalifatidis has cashed in on her newfound fame.
authors: Kristy Johnson For Daily Mail Australia
